intro: Psychotria testacea, commonly known as the red-eyed cycad, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround its small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant has a short, stout stem and produces dense clusters of tiny white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Psychotria testacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
